utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: How could someone get a hold of your credit card number?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I have no idea. But look how much they spent!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Monica, would you calm down? The credit card people said that you only have to pay for the stuff that you bought.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know. It's just such reckless spending.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I think when someone steals your credit card, they've kind of already thrown caution to the wind.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wow, what a geek. They spent $69.95 on a Wonder Mop.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That's me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! The yuk! Ross, he's doing it again!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Marcel, stop humping the lamp! Stop humping! Now Marcel, come back- come here, Marcel-

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no, not in my room! I'll get him.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross, you've got to do something about the humping.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What? It's, it's just a phase.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, that's what we said about Joey...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Would you all relax? It's not that big a deal.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Stop it! Marcel! Bad monkey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Let's just say my Curious George doll is no longer curious.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, Monica. You are not still going over that thing.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This woman's living my life.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: She's living my life, and she's doing it better than me! Look at this, look. She buys tickets for plays that I wanna see. She, she buys clothes from stores that I'm intimidated by the sales people. She spent three hundred dollars on art supplies.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You're not an artist.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, well I might be if I had the supplies! I mean, I could do all this stuff. Only I don't.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, Monica, c'mon, you do cool things.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh really? Okay, let's compare, shall we.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, it's so late for 'Shall we'...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Do I go horseback riding in the park? Do I take classes at the New School?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Nooo...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This is so unfair! She's got everything I want, and she doesn't have my mother.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: How about Joey... Pepponi?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, still too ethnic. My agent thinks I should have a name that's more neutral.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Joey... Switzerland?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Plus, y'know, I think it should be Joe. Y'know, Joey makes me sound like I'm, I dunno, this big. Which I'm not.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Joe...Joe...Joe...Stalin?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Stalin...Stalin...do I know that name? It sounds familiar.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, it does not ring a bell with me...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Joe Stalin. Y'know, that's pretty good.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Might wanna try Joseph.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Joseph Stalin. I think you'd remember that!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yes! Bye Bye Birdie, starring Joseph Stalin. Joseph Stalin is the Fiddler on the Roof.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi. Hi, uh, yes, this is Monica Geller. Um, I believe I'm taking some classes with you and I was wondering what they were.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Alright, great. Thanks a lot. I'm going to tap class.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What, what, so that you can dance with the woman that stole your credit card?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This woman's got my life, I should get to see who she is.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Go to the post office! I'm sure her picture's up! ...Okay, Monica, y'know what, honey, you're kinda losing it here! I mean, this is really becoming like a weird obsession thing.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: This is madness. It's madness, I tell you, for the love of God, Monica, don't do it!! ...Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What d'you think?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Lotsa things.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Which one do you think she is?

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: May I help you?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, no thanks, we're just here to observe.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: You don't observe a dance class. You dance a dance class. Spare shoes are over there.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What does she mean?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I think she means 'You dance a dance class'. Oh, c'mon, c'mon.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, d'y'see anybody you think could be me?

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: People! Last time there were some empty yoghurt containers lying around after class. Let's not have that happen again!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: She could be you.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: Let's get started. Five, six, a-five six seven eight...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, I'm not getting this!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I'm totally getting it!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Did you ever feel like sometimes you are just so unbelievably uncoordinated?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? You just click when they click.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: Alright people, now everyone grab a partner.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay. And, my, dead, mother, says, you, are, it. I'm with Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Great. It's gym class all over again.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
utterance.content: Aww.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: Well that's all right, you can come up to the front and dance with me.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why don't I just take off my clothes and have a nightmare.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: It's okay, it's okay, I'm here, I'm here. Sorry I'm late, okay, here I am. Who's the new tense girl?

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: She's your partner.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Hi. I'm Monica.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh. Monica! ...Hi. I'm Mo- ...nana.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Monana?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah. It's Dutch.

utterance.speaker: Fake Monica
utterance.content: You're kidding! I-I spent three years in Amsterdam.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Um, Pennsylvania Dutch.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: And we're dancing. A-five, six, seven, eight...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Chandler and Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Where've you been?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: At the vet.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: She's not gonna make you wear one of those big plastic cones, is she?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She says Marcel's humping thing's not a phase. Apparently he's reached sexual maturity.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! He beat ya.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She says as time goes on, he's gonna start getting agressive and violent.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So what does this mean?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm gonna have to give him up.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I can't believe it, Ross. This sucks!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don't get it, I mean, you just got him. How can he be an adult already?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know. I know. I mean, one day, he's this little thing, and before you know it, he's this little thing I can't get off my leg.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Isn't there any way you can keep him?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, no. The vet says unless he's in a place where he has regular access to some... monkey lovin,' he's just gonna get vicious. I've just gotta get him into a zoo.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: How do you get a monkey into a zoo?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I know that one! ...No, that's Popes into a Volkswagen.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, we're applying to a lot of them. Naturally our first choice would be one of the bigger state zoos, y'know, like, uh, San Diego... right? But that might just be a pipe dream, because, y'know, he's out of state. Uh, my vet, uh, knows someone at Miami, so that's a possibility.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, but that's like two blocks away from the beach. I mean, it's a total party zoo.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey. We found her, we found the girl.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Did you call the cops?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Nope. We took her to lunch.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ah. Your own brand of vigilante justice.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?! Are you insane? This woman stole from you. She stole. She's a stealer.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y'know what? After you're with this woman for like ten minutes, you forget all that. I mean, she is this astounding person, with this, with this amazing spirit.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, which she probably stole from some cheerleader.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: ...Take off their hats!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Popes in a Volkswagen! ...I love that joke.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No way. No way did you do this.

utterance.speaker: Fake Monica
utterance.content: Monana was very brave.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It was so wild. We told them we were the Gunnersens in room six fifteen. Only to find out the Boston Celtics had taken over the entire sixth floor!

utterance.speaker: Fake Monica
utterance.content: So once they caught on to the fact that we're, y'know, short and have breasts...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: ...They threw us out! I was thrown out of a hotel! Me!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Go Monana! Well, you ladies are not the only ones living the dream. I get to go pour coffee for people I don't know. Don't wait up.

utterance.speaker: Fake Monica
utterance.content: Oh, by the way, tomorrow we're auditioning for a Broadway show.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: 'Scuse me?

utterance.speaker: Fake Monica
utterance.content: There's an open call for Cats. I'm thinking we go down there, sing Memories and make complete fools of ourselves. Whaddya say?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nononononono. Think who you're dealing with here. I mean, I'm not like you. I-I can't even stand in front of a tap class.

utterance.speaker: Fake Monica
utterance.content: Well, that's just probably 'cause of your Amish background.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Fake Monica
utterance.content: Well, you're Pennsylvania Dutch, right?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Right. Till I bought a blow dryer, then I was shunned.

utterance.speaker: Fake Monica
utterance.content: I-I used to be just like you. And then one day I saw a movie that changed my life. Did you ever see Dead Poets' Society?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Fake Monica
utterance.content: I thought that movie was so incredibly... boring. I mean, that thing at the end where the kid kills himself because he can't be in the play? What was that?! It's like, kid, wait a year, leave home, do some community theatre. I walked out of there and I thought, 'Now, that's two hours of my life that I'm never getting back.' And that thought scared me more than all the other crap I was afraid to do.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow. Then I would definitely not recommend Mrs. Doubtfire.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh God. We didn't get into Scranton. That was like our safety zoo. They take like dogs and cows. See? I don't know who this is harder on, me or him.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I'd say that chair's taking the brunt.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Marcel! Marcel! Marcel, no! Good boy. See, how can nobody want him?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, somebody will.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You know there already is a Joseph Stalin?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You're kidding.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Apparently he was this Russian dictator who slaughtered all these people. You'd think you would've known that!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y'know, you'd think I would've.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Phoebe. Whaddyou think a good stage name for me would be?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: ...Flame Boy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Where exactly is your zoo?

utterance.speaker: Dr. Baldhara
utterance.content: Well, it's technically not a zoo per se, it's more of an interactive wildlife experience. Let me ask you some questions about, is it, uh, Marcel?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Baldhara
utterance.content: Does he, uh, fight with other animals?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No-no, he's, he's very docile.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Baldhara
utterance.content: Even if he were... cornered?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well I, I don't know. Why?

utterance.speaker: Dr. Baldhara
utterance.content: Uh, how is he at handling small objects?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: He can hold a banana, if that's whatcha mean...

utterance.speaker: Dr. Baldhara
utterance.content: How about a hammer, or a small blade?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Why- why- why would he need a blade?

utterance.speaker: Dr. Baldhara
utterance.content: Well, if he's up against a jungle cat or an animal with horns, you've got to give the little guy something. Otherwise it's just cruel.

utterance.speaker: Chandler and Joey
utterance.content: He- he- he got in, he- he got in to San Diego.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: We, we come back from our walk and the- the phone was ringing...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: ...He's in.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: He's in! Oh, did you hear that, Marcel? San Diego. San Diego!

utterance.speaker: Dr. Baldhara
utterance.content: You're making a big mistake here. I mean, San Diego's all well and good, but if you give him to me, I'll start him off against a blind rabbit and give you twenty percent of the gains.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yo- hooo!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Where the hell've you been?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Monica and I just crashed an embassy party.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Are you drunk?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Noooo! I'm lying. I am so drunk.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh God, oh. Great, Monica, y'know what, you could've called, I have been up here, I've been worried...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Monica? Monica!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Water rules!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes, yes, it does. Okay, look, the restaurant called, they wanna know if you're gonna be showing up for work?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nope. Going to the Big Apple Circus today.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay Monica, what are you doing? You're gonna lose your job! This is not you!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, it is me! Y'know, I'm not just the person who needs to fluff the pillows and pay the bills as soon as they come in! Y'know, when I'm with her, I am so much more than that. I'm- I'm Monana!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hello? Yes, she is, hold on a second, please. Monana, it's for you, the credit card people.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Helloooo? Yeah. Oh my God. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: They've arrested Monica.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Fake Monica
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How are you?

utterance.speaker: Fake Monica
utterance.content: I'm not too bad. Fortunately, blue's my colour. How-how did you know I was here?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Because... I'm Monica Geller. It was my credit card you were using.

utterance.speaker: Fake Monica
utterance.content: That I was not expecting.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I want you to know, it wasn't me who turned you in.

utterance.speaker: Fake Monica
utterance.content: Oh. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, thank you! You have given me so much! I mean, if it wasn't for you, I would never have gotten to sing Memories on the stage at the Wintergarden Theater!

utterance.speaker: Fake Monica
utterance.content: Well, actually, you only got to sing 'Memo-'.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I just can't believe you're in here. I mean, what am I gonna do without you? Who's gonna crash the embassy parties with me? Who's gonna take me to the Big Apple Circus?

utterance.speaker: Fake Monica
utterance.content: Monica, I started my day by peeing in front of twenty-five other women, and you're worried about who's gonna take you to the Big Apple Circus?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, not... worried, just... wondering.

utterance.speaker: Fake Monica
utterance.content: There's nothing to wonder about, Monica. You're gonna go back to being exactly who you were, because that's who you are.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Not necessarily...

utterance.speaker: Fake Monica
utterance.content: Yes necessarily! I mean, I dunno what it is, maybe it's the Amish thing.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Um, I'm not actually Amish.

utterance.speaker: Fake Monica
utterance.content: Really? Then why are you like that?

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: You by the door. In or out?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: In.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: You in the back, you're getting it all wrong!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, but at least I'm doing it!

utterance.speaker: PA
utterance.content: This is the final boarding call for flight 67 to San Diego, boarding at gate 42A.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay. Good-bye, little monkey guy. Alright, I wrote you this poem. Okay, but don't eat it 'till you get on the plane.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Aww. Thank you, Aunt Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, bye, champ. Now, I know there's gonna be a lot of babes in San Diego, but remember, there's also a lot to learn.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I dunno what to say, Ross. Uh, it's a monkey.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Just, just say what you feel.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Marcel, I'm hungry.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That was good.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Marcel, this is for you. It's, uh, just, y'know, something to, um, do on the plane.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, if you guys don't mind, I'd like to take a moment, just me and him.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh, sure. Sure, absolutely.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Marcel, c'mere, c'mere. Well buddy, this is it. There's just a coupla things I want to say. I'm really gonna miss you, and I'm never gonna forget about you. You've been more than just a pet to me, you've been more like a be- Okay, Marcel, please, could you leave my leg alone? Could you just stop humping me for two seconds?! Marcel, would- okay, just take him away. Just take him.
